Life Below Water

Award: Wood Pencil

                                Wood Pencil / Film / Social Commercials Over 30 Seconds / 2021
                            


Award: Shortlist

                                Shortlist / Writing for Advertising / Film
                            


Narrated by the legendary Morgan Freeman and created to raise awareness for the United Nations Sustainable Development Goal #14, Life Below Water: The Arrival of a New Species is a documentary-style short film that provides viewers with an eerie sneak peek at the year 2050. This is the year in which the World Economic Forum estimates there will be more plastic in the ocean than fish. Although initially created to premiere at Tribeca and run on YouTube as a skippable pre-roll, the film made it all the way to the UN General Assembly, where it was presented to hundreds of world leaders.
